textBox.richText: Okay, after what I thought was going to be a no-brainer quickie app, I’m finally ready to announce a calculator for people who deal with timecodes (primarily editors, directors, sound designers, etc.). Whew, not only was the basic algorithm a major hurdle, but because I thought this was going to be easy I coded fast and loose. Now there’s the payback of bunches of bugs. So, I’m releasing a Beta version (v. 0.9). I expect bugs here; so should you. And tell me about ‘em. They *will* be fixed. And then there’ll be the real release, a nice clean version (1.0, yay!). And yeah, like my other little apps, this will be a no-cost add-free app for the Android. So ask for it on you Android Market. App Features: * Add, Subtract, Multiply, and Divide SMPTE timecodes. * Set any frame rate from 3 to 99 frames per second. * Correctly and intuitively works with Drop Frame timecodes, used extensively in NTSC environments. * Works nicely with built-in keyboards. * Optionally implements sound and haptic (vibrations) feedback. * Saves your preferences.
Introducing a new calculator for SMPTE
